Description: This registry defines HTTP status messages that are not covered by the Base Message Registry

Conflict.Description: Indicates that the request could not be completed because it would cause a conflict in the current state of the resources supported by the platform
Conflict.Message: The request to %1 cannot be completed because it would cause a conflict in the current state of the resources supported by the platform
Conflict.Resolution: Resolve conflict and try request again

Gone.Description: Indicates that the requested resource is no longer available in the server. This condition is likely to be permanent.
Gone.Message: The requested resource is no longer available in the server.

LengthRequired.Description: Indicates that request did not specify the length of its content using the Content-Length header and the resource requires the Content-Length header
LengthRequired.Message: The request to %1 cannot be completed because the requested resource requires the Content-Length header be present

MethodNotAllowed.Description: Indicates that the HTTP method for the request is not supported for this request URI
MethodNotAllowed.Message: The method %1 is not allowed for the URI %2
MethodNotAllowed.Resolution: Use a method listed in the Allow header

MultipartBoundaryRequired.Description: Indicates that the request did not specify the boundary in Content-Type header.
MultipartBoundaryRequired.Message: The request to %1 is lacking boundary in Content-Type.

MultipartFormatIncomplete.Description: Indicates that the multipart parser does not received close-delimiter.
MultipartFormatIncomplete.Message: The multipart body of request to %1 is incomplete.
MultipartFormatIncomplete.Resolution: Resend the proper multipart format body defined by RFC 7578.

MultipartParseError.Description: Indicates that an error occurred during parsing multipart body.
MultipartParseError.Message: The request to %1 cannot completed due to an error of parsing multipart body.
MultipartParseError.Resolution: Resend the multipart body in well format defined in RFC 7578.

MultipartPartHeaderTooLong.Description: Indicates that the header in part(s) is too long.
MultipartPartHeaderTooLong.Message: The header of part in request body to %1 is too long.
MultipartPartHeaderTooLong.Resolution: Change header(s) in part(s) only contains Content-Disposition and Content-Type without any others data.

MultipartPartNameRequired.Description: Indicates that there is no name="xxxx" in header of part(s).
MultipartPartNameRequired.Message: The body of request to %1 is lacking in name="xxx" in header of part(s).
MultipartPartNameRequired.Resolution: Provide name in header of each part.(RFC 7578)

MultipartWritingFileFailed.Description: Indicates that server fail to write to file during parsing multipart body.
MultipartWritingFileFailed.Message: The request to %1 fail to write file during parsing multipart body.

NotAcceptable.Description: Indicates that the resource identified by this request is not capable of generating a representation corresponding to one of the media types in the Accept header
NotAcceptable.Message: The resource at %1 cannot be represented as any of the media types in the request Accept header
NotAcceptable.Resolution: Verify that Accept header in request is correct

NotImplemented.Description: Indicates that the server does not recognize the request method and is not capable of supporting the method for any resource
NotImplemented.Message: The request to %1 cannot be completed because the server does not support the %2 method for any resource
NotImplemented.Resolution: Use a method listed in the Allow header

PayloadTooLarge.Description: Indicates that the request entity is larger than limits defined by server.
PayloadTooLarge.Message: The request size is %1 and the maximum size for this resource is %2.

PreconditionFailed.Description: Indicates that the one or more of the precondition(s) in the request-header failed
PreconditionFailed.Message: The request to %1 cannot be completed because the %2 precondition failed

RequestBodyIncomplete.Description: Indicates that the received request body is shorter than Content-Length header.
RequestBodyIncomplete.Message: The body of request to %1 is shorter than Content-Length header
RequestBodyIncomplete.Resolution: Provide correct Content-Length header in request.

UnsupportedMediaType.Description: Indicates that the request specifies a Content-Type for the body that is not supported
UnsupportedMediaType.Message: The request to %1 cannot be completed because the Content-Type %2 is not supported
UnsupportedMediaType.Resolution: Verify Content-Type header is correct and send request in a supported format

Name: HTTP Statuses Message Registry
